member.name: F:BEPUik.IKConstraint.StiffnessOverDamping
member.summary: The rigidity of a constraint is used to derive the stiffness and damping coefficients using a fixed stiffness:damping ratio.
member.remarks: This is used over independent coefficients because IK usages of the constraints don't really vary in behavior, just strength.

member.name: M:BEPUik.IKConstraint.Preupdate(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Updates the softness, bias factor, and maximum impulse based on the current time step.
member.param: Time step duration.
Inverse time step duration.

member.name: M:BEPUik.IKConstraint.UpdateJacobiansAndVelocityBias
member.summary: Update the jacobians for the latest position and orientation bone states and store a velocity bias based on the error.

member.name: M:BEPUik.IKConstraint.ComputeEffectiveMass
member.summary: Computes the effective mass matrix for the constraint for the current jacobians.

member.name: M:BEPUik.IKConstraint.WarmStart
member.summary: Applies the accumulated impulse to warm up the constraint solving process.

member.name: M:BEPUik.IKConstraint.SolveVelocityIteration
member.summary: Applies impulses to satisfy the velocity constraint.

member.name: M:BEPUik.IKConstraint.ClearAccumulatedImpulses
member.summary: Clears out the accumulated impulse.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKConstraint.Rigidity
member.summary: Gets the rigidity of the constraint. Higher values correspond to more rigid constraints, lower values to less rigid constraints. Must be positive.
member.remarks: Scaling up the rigidity is like preparing the constraint to handle a heavier load. If the load is proportionally heavier, the damping ratio stays the same. If the load stays the same but the rigidity increases, the result is a more rigid joint, but with a slightly different damping ratio. In other words, modifying rigidity without modifying the effective mass of the system results in a variable damping ratio. This isn't a huge problem in practice- there is a massive ultra-damping hack in IK bone position integration that make a little physical deviation or underdamping irrelevant.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKConstraint.MaximumForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the constraint can apply.

member.name: P:BEPUik.SingleBoneConstraint.TargetBone
member.summary: Gets or sets the bone associated with the single bone constraint.

member.name: T:BEPUik.IKLimit
member.summary: Connects two bones together.

member.name: T:BEPUik.IKJoint
member.summary: Connects two bones together.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKJoint.ConnectionB
member.summary: Gets the second bone connected by this joint.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKJoint.IsActive
member.summary: Gets whether or not the joint is a member of the active set as determined by the last IK solver execution.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKJoint.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not this joint is enabled. If set to true, this joint will be a part of the joint graph and will undergo solving. If set to false, this joint will be removed from the connected bones and will no longer be traversable.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angle between the two axes allowed by the constraint.

summary.para: This is a little experimental project designed to iteratively converge to a decent solution to full body inverse kinematics subject to a variety of constraints.

It's currently separated from the rest of BEPUphysics library internals because the immediate goal is to test out features to be potentially integrated into a blender content pipeline. BEPUphysics interactions with this system will have to go through the interfaces like everything else for now.

member.name: M:BEPUik.IKSolver.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new IKSolver.

member.name: M:BEPUik.IKSolver.Solve(System.Collections.Generic.List{BEPUik.IKJoint})
member.summary: Updates the positions of bones acted upon by the joints given to this solver. This variant of the solver can be used when there are no goal-driven controls in the simulation. This amounts to running just the 'fixer iterations' of a normal control-driven solve.

member.name: M:BEPUik.IKSolver.Solve(System.Collections.Generic.List{BEPUik.Control})
member.summary: Updates the positions of bones acted upon by the controls given to this solver.
member.param: List of currently active controls.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKSolver.ActiveSet
member.summary: Gets the active joint set associated with the solver.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKSolver.ControlIterationCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of solver iterations to perform in an attempt to reach specified goals.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKSolver.FixerIterationCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of solter iterations to perform after the control iterations in an attempt to minimize errors introduced by unreachable goals.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKSolver.VelocitySubiterationCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of velocity iterations to perform per control or fixer iteration.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKSolver.AutoscaleControlImpulses
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to scale control impulses such that they fit well with the mass of objects.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKSolver.AutoscaleControlMaximumForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum impulse the controls will try to push bones with when AutoscaleControlImpulses is enabled.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKSolver.TimeStepDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the time step duration elapsed by each position iteration.

Direction of the line attached to the first bone in world space. Must be unit length.

member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the line in connection A's local space. Must be unit length.

member.summary: Constructs a new orientation joint. Orientation joints can be used to simulate the angular portion of a hinge. Orientation joints allow rotation around only a single axis.
member.param: First entity connected in the orientation joint.
Second entity connected in the orientation joint.
Axis allowed to rotate freely in world space.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKRevoluteJoint.LocalFreeAxisA
member.summary: Gets or sets the free axis in connection A's local space. Must be unit length.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKRevoluteJoint.LocalFreeAxisB
member.summary: Gets or sets the free axis in connection B's local space. Must be unit length.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKRevoluteJoint.WorldFreeAxisA
member.summary: Gets or sets the free axis attached to connection A in world space. This does not change the other connection's free axis.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKRevoluteJoint.WorldFreeAxisB
member.summary: Gets or sets the free axis attached to connection B in world space. This does not change the other connection's free axis.

member.name: F:BEPUik.SingleBoneAngularPlaneConstraint.PlaneNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets normal of the plane which the bone's axis will be constrained to..

member.name: F:BEPUik.SingleBoneAngularPlaneConstraint.BoneLocalAxis
member.summary: Axis to constrain to the plane in the bone's local space.

member.name: T:BEPUik.ActiveSet
member.summary: Manages the subset of joints which potentially need solving. The active joint set contains connected components in the joint-bone graph which interact with control constraints. These connected components can be bounded by pinned bones which do not transfer any motion.

member.name: M:BEPUik.ActiveSet.Clear
member.summary: Clears out the bone and joint listings and unsets all flags.

member.name: M:BEPUik.ActiveSet.UpdateActiveSet(System.Collections.Generic.List{BEPUik.Control})
member.summary: Updates the ordered set of active joints. Joints are ordered according to their graph traversal distance from control constraints. Joints close to the control constraints are closer to index 0 than joints that are far from control constraints. The relative ordering of joints from different connected components is irrelevant; the only guarantee is that constraints further from the source in a particular connected component are later in the list than those that are close.
member.param: Currently active control constraints.

member.name: P:BEPUik.ActiveSet.Joints
member.summary: Gets the most recently computed set of active joints sorted by their traversal distance from control constraints.

member.name: P:BEPUik.ActiveSet.Bones
member.summary: Gets the most recently computed set of active bones sorted by their traversal distance from control constraints.

member.name: P:BEPUik.ActiveSet.UseAutomass
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to automatically configure the masses of bones in the active set based upon their dependencies. Enabling this makes the solver more responsive and avoids some potential instability. This will overwrite any existing mass settings.

member.name: P:BEPUik.ActiveSet.AutomassUnstressedFalloff
member.summary: Gets or sets the multiplier applied to the mass of a bone before distributing it to the child bones. Used only when UseAutomass is set to true.

member.name: P:BEPUik.ActiveSet.AutomassTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass that the heaviest bones will have when automass is enabled.

member.name: T:BEPUik.RevoluteControl
member.summary: Constrains an individual bone in an attempt to keep a bone-attached axis aligned with a specified world axis.

member.name: P:BEPUik.RevoluteControl.TargetBone
member.summary: Gets or sets the controlled bone.

member.name: P:BEPUik.RevoluteControl.AngularMotor
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear motor used by the control.

member.name: T:BEPUik.Bone
member.summary: Piece of a character which is moved by constraints.

member.name: F:BEPUik.Bone.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the bone.

member.name: F:BEPUik.Bone.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the bone.

member.name: F:BEPUik.Bone.angularVelocity
member.summary: The mid-iteration angular velocity associated with the bone. This is computed during the velocity subiterations and then applied to the orientation at the end of each position iteration.

member.name: F:BEPUik.Bone.linearVelocity
member.summary: The mid-iteration linear velocity associated with the bone. This is computed during the velocity subiterations and then applied to the position at the end of each position iteration.

member.name: F:BEPUik.Bone.InertiaTensorScaling
member.summary: An arbitrary scaling factor is applied to the inertia tensor. This tends to improve stability.

member.name: M:BEPUik.Bone.#ctor(BEPUutilities.Vector3,BEPUutilities.Quaternion,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a new bone.
member.param: Initial position of the bone.
Initial orientation of the bone.
Radius of the bone.
Height of the bone.
Mass of the bone.

member.name: M:BEPUik.Bone.#ctor(BEPUutilities.Vector3,BEPUutilities.Quaternion,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a new bone. Assumes the mass will be set later.
member.param: Initial position of the bone.
Initial orientation of the bone.
Radius of the bone.
Height of the bone.

member.name: M:BEPUik.Bone.UpdateInertiaTensor
member.summary: Updates the world inertia tensor based upon the local inertia tensor and current orientation.

member.name: M:BEPUik.Bone.UpdatePosition
member.summary: Integrates the position and orientation of the bone forward based upon the current linear and angular velocity.

member.name: F:BEPUik.Bone.traversed
member.summary: Used by the per-control traversals to find stressed paths. It has to be separate from the IsActive flag because the IsActive flag is used in the same traversal to denote all visited bones (including unstressed ones). Also used in the unstressed traversals; FindCycles uses the IsActive flag and the following DistributeMass phase uses the traversed flag.

member.name: F:BEPUik.Bone.stressCount
member.summary: The number of stressed paths which use this bone. A stressed path is a possible path between a pin and a control.

member.name: F:BEPUik.Bone.predecessors
member.summary: The set of parents of a given bone in a traversal. This is like a list of parents; there can be multiple incoming paths and they all need to be kept handy in order to perform some traversal details.

member.name: F:BEPUik.Bone.unstressedCycle
member.summary: True of the bone is a member of a cycle in an unstressed part of the graph or an unstressed predecessor of an unstressed cycle. Marking all the predecessors is conceptually simpler than attempting to mark the cycles in isolation.

member.name: F:BEPUik.Bone.targetedByOtherControl
member.summary: True if the bone is targeted by a control in the current stress cycle traversal that isn't the current source control.

member.name: P:BEPUik.Bone.Mass
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass of the bone. High mass bones resist motion more than those of small mass. Setting the mass updates the inertia tensor of the bone.

member.name: P:BEPUik.Bone.Joints
member.summary: Gets the list of joints affecting this bone.

member.name: P:BEPUik.Bone.Pinned
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not this bone is pinned. Pinned bones cannot be moved by constraints.

member.name: P:BEPUik.Bone.IsActive
member.summary: Gets whether or not the bone is a member of the active set as determined by the last IK solver execution.

member.name: P:BEPUik.Bone.Radius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of the bone. Setting the radius changes the inertia tensor of the bone.

member.name: P:BEPUik.Bone.HalfHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height, divided by two, of the bone. The half height extends both ways from the center position of the bone. Setting the half height changes the inertia tensor of the bone.

member.name: P:BEPUik.Bone.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the bone. Setting the height changes the inertia tensor of the bone.

member.name: F:BEPUik.SingleBoneRevoluteConstraint.BoneLocalFreeAxis
member.summary: Axis of allowed rotation in the bone's local space.

member.name: P:BEPUik.SingleBoneRevoluteConstraint.FreeAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction to constrain the bone free axis to.

member.name: T:BEPUik.IKAngularJoint
member.summary: Attempts to maintain the relative orientation between two bones.

member.name: F:BEPUik.IKAngularJoint.GoalRelativeOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation from connection A's orientation to connection B's orientation in A's local space.

member.name: M:BEPUik.IKAngularJoint.#ctor(BEPUik.Bone,BEPUik.Bone)
member.summary: Constructs a 3DOF angular joint which tries to keep two bones in angular alignment.
member.param: First bone to connect to the joint.
Second bone to connect to the joint.

member.name: F:BEPUik.SingleBoneLinearMotor.TargetPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the target position to apply to the target bone.

member.name: F:BEPUik.SingleBoneLinearMotor.LocalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset in the bone's local space to the point which will be pulled towards the target position.

member.name: T:BEPUik.IKLinearAxisLimit
member.summary: Keeps an anchor point on one bone between planes defined by another bone.

member.name: F:BEPUik.IKLinearAxisLimit.LocalLineAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset in connection A's local space from the center of mass to the anchor point of the line.

member.name: F:BEPUik.IKLinearAxisLimit.LocalLineDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the line in connection A's local space. Must be unit length.

member.name: F:BEPUik.IKLinearAxisLimit.LocalAnchorB
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset in connection B's local space from the center of mass to the anchor point which will be kept on the line.

member.name: M:BEPUik.IKLinearAxisLimit.#ctor(BEPUik.Bone,BEPUik.Bone,BEPUutilities.Vector3,BEPUutilities.Vector3,BEPUutilities.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a new axis limit.
member.param: First bone connected by the joint.
Second bone connected by the joint.
Anchor point of the line attached to the first bone in world space.
Direction of the line attached to the first bone in world space. Must be unit length.
Anchor point on the second bone in world space which is measured against the other connection's anchor.
Minimum distance that the joint connections should be kept from each other along the axis.
Maximum distance that the joint connections should be kept from each other along the axis.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKLinearAxisLimit.LineAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the world space location of the line anchor attached to connection A.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKLinearAxisLimit.LineDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the world space direction of the line attached to connection A. Must be unit length.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKLinearAxisLimit.AnchorB
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset in world space from the center of mass of connection B to the anchor point.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKLinearAxisLimit.MinimumDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance that the joint connections should be kept from each other.

member.name: P:BEPUik.IKLinearAxisLimit.MaximumDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum distance that the joint connections should be kept from each other.
